bwwExcerpt: Frankly, there’s not much by way of plot that doesn’t feel well-worn, but director Susan Stroman, ably assisted by Beowulf Boritt’s lovely, very efficient set design, Jeff Mahshie’s appealing and city-accurate costumes and projection designs by Jeanette Oi-Suk Yew of leafy Greenwich Village and roma...
nycTheatreExcerpt: "Left on Tenth is a slight endeavor  slighter, probably, than a cancer odyssey has any right to be  and certainly falls short of better Ephron Sister efforts. Even so, there can be only one response to it, and that's well wishes for all."
